docstr: `MASKR` â€” Right justified mask ### Description `MASKL(I[, KIND])` has its rightmost `I` bits set to 1, and the remaining bits set to 0. ### Syntax `RESULT = MASKR(I[, KIND])` ### Arguments . | `KIND` | Shall be a scalar constant expression of type `INTEGER`. ### Return value The return value is of type `INTEGER`. If `KIND` is present, it specifies the kind value of the return type; otherwise, it is of the default integer kind. ### Standard Fortran 2008 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also MASKL
